message.content:
cs.CC, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the approximability of Boolean circuits by polynomials, which is a central topic in computational complexity theory. This suggests that cs.CC (Computational Complexity) is a likely sub-category. The paper also involves information theory, as it discusses the concept of discrepancy, which is a measure of the difference between two distributions. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is another likely sub-category. The paper also uses techniques from discrete mathematics and graph theory, which are relevant to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics). Finally, the paper has implications for machine learning, which falls under cs.LG (Machine Learning).
